_comment: Created by ianb on 16/12/2014 11:18:13 using v2.3
title: How have A&E attendances changed for children aged 0 to 4?
analysis_commentary: A&E attendances in young children (age<5) are often caused by accidental injuries or minor illnesses (ChiMat, 2014) and therefore could potentially be managed in the community. A&E attendances for the youngest children have increased between 2010/11 and 2011/12 from 484 to 511 per 1,000.
data_source: Local Authority Child Health Profiles, ChiMat Health Intelligence Network
